channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024090047
item.description:

  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Approximately 100 gallons of Unknown UN3082 was released from 275-gallon plastic tote due to improper loading. No Drains or soils were reported impacted.

item.title: Report I-2024080049
item.description:
Report I-2024080049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: HATTIESBURG
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 45000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver failed to slow down for a clover leaf curve resulting in the unit rolling over onto the driver side. Single vehicle crash. During the roll over event, dirt built up inside the crash box, breaking the piping from the crows foot. Product start escaping the tank through the broken pipe inside the crash box due to the way the unit came to rest.
